## Type of Change

<!--- Put an `x` ( and remove spaces ) in all the boxes that apply: -->

### Changes in docs (`docs`)

- [ ] âœ¨ `improve(docs)` - e.g. added a new paragraph, example, using a better wording, adding a new document, etc.
- [ ] ğŸ› ï¸ `fix(docs)` - bug fix, e.g. fix a typo, page render issue
- [ ] âŒ `BREAKING CHANGE(docs)` - e.g. removing a document/article/category that was referenced in many other places
- [ ] ğŸ§¹ `refactor(docs)` - changed a code example, e.g. replaced old code with a modern one
- [ ] ğŸ—‘ï¸ `chore(docs)` - other changes that don't affect the docs, e.g. updating the CI/CD pipeline

### Changes in the platform (`platform`)

- [ ] âœ¨ `feat(platform)` - a new feature, e.g. a new MDX component, plugin, theme, etc.
- [ ] ğŸ› ï¸ `fix(platform)` - bug fix, e.g. fix a typo, issue causing component to crash
- [ ] âŒ `BREAKING CHANGE(platform)` - e.g. removing a feature, changing the API, etc.
- [ ] ğŸ§¹ `refactor(platform)` - code improvements, changes, e.g. unifying style, renaming internals, etc.
- [ ] ğŸ“ `docs(platform)` - updated code documentation
- [ ] ğŸ—‘ï¸ `chore(platform)` - other changes that don't affect the platform directly, e.g. updating the CI/CD pipeline
